title: Semantic Communication of Learnable Concepts. (arXiv:2305.08126v1 [cs.IT])
abstract: We consider the problem of communicating a sequence of concepts, i.e., unknown and potentially stochastic maps, which can be observed only through examples, i.e., the mapping rules are unknown. The transmitter applies a learning algorithm to the available examples, and extracts knowledge from the data by optimizing a probability distribution over a set of models, i.e., known functions, which can better describe the observed data, and so potentially the underlying concepts. The transmitter then needs to communicate the learned models to a remote receiver through a rate-limited channel, to allow the receiver to decode the models that can describe the underlying sampled concepts as accurately as possible in their semantic space. After motivating our analysis, we propose the formal problem of communicating concepts, and provide its rate-distortion characterization, pointing out its connection with the concepts of empirical and strong coordination in a network. translated_abstract: 我们考虑了如何传达一系列概念的问题，即未知且可能随机的映射，只能通过示例进行观察，即映射规则是未知的。发射机对可用的样例应用学习算法，并通过优化一组模型上的概率分布来从数据中提取知识，即已知的函数，这些函数可以更好地描述观察的数据，并且可能是基础概念的描述。然后，发射机需要通过速率受限的信道将学习到的模型传达给远程接收机，以便接收机能够在其语义空间中尽可能准确地解码描述基础采样概念的模型。在阐述我们分析的动机后，我们提出了传达概念的形式问题，并提供了其率失真特征，指出其与网络中经验协同和强协同的概念的联系。我们还为t提供了一个界限。
tldr: 本文提出可学习概念的语义通信问题及其率失真特征，并与网络中的经验协同和强协同概念相关联。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes the problem of semantic communication of learnable concepts and its rate-distortion characterization, connected with the concepts of empirical and strong coordination in a network.
